item.title: Makefile Tips
item.description: If you’re new to Make, check out Mike Bostock’s article Why Use Make, it’s excellent! This post is intended as a follow-up to Mike’s introduction. I love Makefiles because they allow me to describe my workflow as a directed acyclic graph. Makefiles are a great example of declarative programming. When I specify a rule like the following: targetfile: sourcefile command I am saying that the targetfile depends on the sourcefile.
